---
title: "Short report on Palmer Penguins"
format: html
---


```{python}
# | echo: false
from palmerpenguins import load_penguins

penguins_df = load_penguins()
penguins_cleaned_df = penguins_df.dropna()

species_count = penguins_cleaned_df.groupby(
    ['species'])['species'].count().sort_values()
```

The palmer penguins dataset contains `{python} len(penguins_cleaned_df)`, the species with the smallest number of penguins is `{python} species_count.index[0]` with `{python} species_count.iloc[0]`.

To look at how the penguins vary in flipper and bill length see [@fig-scatter-flip-and-bill]

```{python}
# | label: fig-scatter-flip-and-bill
# | fig-cap: "Scatter plot of flipper and bill length"
import plotnine as pn

pn_species_col = (
    pn.ggplot(penguins_cleaned_df, pn.aes("bill_length_mm",
                                          "flipper_length_mm",
                                          color="species"))
    + pn.geom_point()
)
pn_species_col
```
